column1: #Text=The polycrystalline DyNiSi compound was synthesized by arc-melting appropriate proportion of constituent components with the purity better than 99.9 wt.% in a water-cooled copper hearth under purified argon atmosphere.
#Text=The as-cast sample was annealed in a high-vacuum quartz tube at 1073 K for 7 days and then quenched into liquid nitrogen.
#Text=The X-ray diffraction (XRD) measurements on bulk and powder samples were performed at room temperature by using Cu Kα radiation.
#Text=The Rietveld refinement based on the powder XRD pattern confirms that the annealed sample crystallizes in a single phase with TiNiSi-type orthorhombic structure (space group Pnma).
#Text=Microstructures were investigated by scanning electron microscopy (SEM) using a LEO-1450 microscope.
#Text=A rectangular-like sample of 1.2 mg with dimensions 1.0 mm × 0.5 mm × 0.5 mm was selected for the magnetic measurements.
#Text=Magnetization was measured using a commercial superconducting quantum interference device (SQUID) magnetometer from Quantum Design Inc (model MPMS-XL).
#Text=The magnetization as a function of rotation angle was measured under applied fields up to 20 kOe by rotating the sample from perpendicular to parallel direction with a step of 10°.
#Text=Here, the rotation angle θ is defined as 0° when the longitudinal direction of columnar grains is parallel to the magnetic field.
